title: What can I do if my phone runs out of power quickly?
answer:
l    Turn on power saving mode. Go to **Settings **, touch **Power saving **, and select a power saving mode or close power-intensive applications. 

 ![fig_powersave_manage_2.0.png](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141202195726879001.gif) 

 l    Turn off the screen when you aren't using your phone. 

 l    Reduce the screen timeout period. 

 l    Reduce the screen brightness. 

 l    Reduce the volume. 

 l    Turn off your mobile network, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, or GPS from the notification panel when you aren't using them. 

 Huawei releases updates on its official website from time to time. To optimize your user experience, go to [http://consumer.huawei.com/en/ ](http://consumer.huawei.com/cn/ " ") to download and install updates for your phone model or use the online update feature to update your phone. 

 If the problem persists, contact Huawei technical support or take your phone to an authorized Huawei service center. 

 ** ![ËµÃ](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141202195726746002.jpg) ** 

 For details about authorized Huawei service centers, go to [http://consumer.huawei.com/en/support/service-center/index.htm ](http://consumer.huawei.com/cn/support/service-center/index.htm " ") . 

 Note: The figures are for your reference only. The actual screens may vary.
